title: Out of Africa Map- draw conclusions

content.description:
Map Showing an Overview of the Slave Trade out of Africa

The map is centered on the south Atlantic Ocean and shows the following continents:
North America
South America
Europe
Asia
Africa
The map depicts numbers of enslaved people transported from Africa to various parts of the world from 1500 to 1900. The numbers are as follows:
All values are approximate.
From West Central Africa to Brazil: 8,000,000
From West Africa and West Central Africa to the Caribbean and North America: 11,000,000. These enslaved people were transported as follows:
United States: 1,000,000
Cuba: 2,000,000
Veracruz and Cartagena: 1,000,000
Jamaica: 4,000,000
St. Domingue: 2,000,000
Barbados: 1,000,000
From West Africa to North Africa: 4,000,000
From West Africa to Europe: fewer than 1,000,000
From West Africa and from the Swahili Coast of East Africa to Egypt, Arabia, Asia, and India: 8,000,000
From the Swahili Coast of East Africa and from Madagascar to the Mascarene Islands: 1,000,000
From the Swahili Coast of East Africa to Rio de la Plata: 1,000,000
content.question: Which of the following conclusions can be drawn from the information presented in the map?

choices.label: The majority of enslaved African people were sent from East Africa to Europe.
The majority of enslaved African people were sent from North Africa to North America.
More enslaved African people were sent to Brazil than to the United States.
More enslaved African people were sent to Tunisia than to Egypt.

content.answer: More enslaved African people were sent to Brazil than to the United States.

topic.text: 2.16: Diasporic Connections: Slavery and Freedom in Brazil

skill.text: 2.D: Describe and draw conclusions from patterns, trends, and limitations in data, making connections to relevant course content.
